00036 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00037 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00038 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00039 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00040 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:

00043 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00044 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00045 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00046    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00047    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but uses a dedicated
00048    APIC-based timer interrupt instead, i.e. RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI). */
00049 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00050 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00051 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00052 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00057 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)

00060 struct xnthread;
00061 struct task_struct;
00062 
00063 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00064 
00065     /* Kernel mode side */
00066     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00067     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00068     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00069     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00070     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00071 
00072     /* User mode side */
00073     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00074     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00075 
00076     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00077     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00078     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00079 
00080 } xnarchtcb_t;
00081 
00082 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00083 
00084     unsigned vector;
00085     long errcode;
00086     struct pt_regs *regs;
00087 
00088 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00089 
00090 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((fi)->vector)
00091 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->errcode)
00092 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->eip)
00093 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00094    Linux stack context. */
00095 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00096                                  ((fi)->vector != 1 && (fi)->vector != 3))

00101 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00102 
00103 {
00104     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00105         return vmalloc(bytes);
00106 
00107     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00108 }
00109 
00110 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00111 
00112 {
00113     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00114         vfree(chunk);
00115     else
00116         kfree(chunk);
00117 }

00119 static inline int xnarch_shadow_p (xnarchtcb_t *tcb, struct task_struct *task)
00120 {
00121     return tcb->espp == &task->thread.esp; /* Sign of shadow... */
00122 }

00124 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00125 
00126 {
00127     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00128 }

00136 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00137                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00138     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00141 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00142 
00143 {
00144     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00145 
00146     adeos_load_cpuid();
00147 
00148     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00149        and always inside a critical section. */
00150     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00151     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00152     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00153     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00154     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00155 }
00156 
00157 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00158 {
00159     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00160 }
00161 
00162 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00163                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00164                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00165                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00166                                     )
00167 {
00168 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00169 
00170     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00171         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00172         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00173         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00174         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00175         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00176         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00177         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00178         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00179         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00180         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00181         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00182         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00183         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00184         "ret\n\t" \
00185 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00186         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00187         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00188       : /* no output */ \
00189       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00190         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00191         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00192         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00193         "b" (out_tcb), \
00194         "S" (in_tcb), \
00195         "a" (outproc), \
00196         "d" (inproc));
00197 
00198 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00199 
00200     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00201     
00202     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00203         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00204         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00205         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00206         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00207         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00208         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00209         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00210         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00211         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00212         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00213         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00214         "ret\n\t" \
00215 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00216       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00217         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00218         "=S" (esi_out), \
00219         "=D" (edi_out), \
00220         "+a" (outproc), \
00221         "+d" (inproc) \
00222       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00223         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00224         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00225         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00226 
00227 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00228 }
00229 
00230 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00231                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00232 {
00233     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00234     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00235 
00236     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)
00237         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00238            clear the ts bit. */
00239         clts();
00240     
00241     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00242 
00243     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00244         {
00245         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00246 
00247         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00248 
00249         if (!inproc->mm)
00250             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00251         }
00252 
00253     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00254 
00255     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00256 
00257         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00258            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00259            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00260            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00261            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00262            raw I/O ops. */
00263 
00264         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00265 
00266         barrier();
00267 
00268         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00269             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, adeos_processor_id());
00270 
00271             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00272                 
00273                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00274 
00275                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00276                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00277                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00278                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00279 
00280                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00281                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00282             }
00283         }
00284     }
00285 
00286     stts();
00287 }
00288 
00289 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00290                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00291 {
00292     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00293 }
00294 
00295 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00296 {
00297     /* Empty */
00298 }
00299 
00300 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00301                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00302                                          const char *name)
00303 {
00304     tcb->user_task = current;
00305     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00306     tcb->esp = 0;
00307     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00308     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00309     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00310 }
00311 
00312 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00313                                                int imask,
00314                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00315                                                void *cookie)
00316 {
00317     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00318     stts();
00319     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00320     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00321     entry(cookie);
00322     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00323 }
00324 
00325 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00326                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00327                                        void *cookie,
00328                                        int imask,
00329                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00330                                        char *name)
00331 {
00332     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00333 
00334     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00335     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00336     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00337     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00338     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00339     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00340     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00341     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00342     *--(*psp) = 0;
00343 }
00344 
00345 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00346 
00347 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00348 
00349 {
00350     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00351        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00352 
00353     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00354 
00355     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00356         {
00357         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00358         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00359         }
00360 }
00361 
00362 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00363 
00364 {
00365     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00366     
00367     if(task)
00368         {
00369         if(!(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00370             return;
00371 
00372         /* Tell Linux that we already saved the state of the FPU hardware
00373            of this task. */
00374         task->thread_info->status &= ~TS_USEDFPU;
00375         }
00376 
00377     clts();
00378     
00379     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00380         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00381     else
00382         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00383 }
00384 
00385 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00386 
00387 {
00388     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00389 
00390     if (task)
00391         {
00392 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 11)
00393         if (!tsk_used_math(task))
00394 #else
00395         if (!task->used_math)
00396 #endif
00397             {
00398             stts();
00399             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00400             }
00401 
00402         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00403            hardware. */
00404         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00405         }
00406 
00407     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00408        user-space or kernel thread. */
00409     clts();
00410 
00411     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00412         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00413     else
00414         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00415 }
00416 
00417 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00418 
00419 {
00420     clts();
00421 
00422     if(!cpu_has_fxsr && tcb->user_task)
00423     /* fnsave also initializes the FPU state, so that on cpus prior to PII
00424        (i.e. without fxsr), we need to restore the saved state. */
00425         xnarch_restore_fpu(tcb);
00426 }
00427 
00428 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00429 
00430 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00431 
00432 {}
00433 
00434 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00435 
00436 {}
00437 
00438 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00439 
00440 {}
00441 
00442 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00443 
00444 {}
00445 
00446 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */

00450 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00451 
00452     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00453 }
00454 
00455 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00456 
00457 {
00458     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00459                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00460                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00461                                      NULL,
00462                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00463 }
00464 
00465 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00466 
00467 {
00468     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00469                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00470                                      NULL,
00471                                      NULL,
00472                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00473 }
00474 
00475 static struct linux_semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00476 
00477 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00478 {
00479     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00480 }
00481 
00482 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00483     
00484 {
00485     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00486     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00487     unsigned long flags;
00488     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00489 
00490     sema_init(&xnarch_finalize_sync,0);
00491 
00492     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00493        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00494        context. */
00495     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00496                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00497 
00498     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00499     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00500     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00501     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00502 
00503     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00504         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00505     
00506     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00507                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00508 }
00509 
00510 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00511 
00512 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00513 
00514     return 0;
00515 }
00516 
00517 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00518 
00519     return 0;
00520 }
00521 
00522 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00523 
00524     return 0;
00525 }
00526 
00527 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00528 
00529 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00530 
00531 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00532 
00533 {
00534 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00535     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00536        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00537     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00538 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00539 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00540     xnshadow_release_events();
00541 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00542     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00543     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00544     schedule_timeout(50);
00545     xnarch_release_ipi();
00546 }
00547 
00548 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00549 
00550 {
00551     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00552 
00553     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00554         {
00555         spl_t s;
00556         splsync(s);
00557         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00558         splexit(s);
00559         return 1;
00560         }
00561 
00562     return 0;
00563 }
00564 
00565 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00566 
00567 {
00568 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00569     xnshadow_grab_events();
00570 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00571 }
00572 
00573 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00575 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00576 
00577 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00578 {
00579     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00580     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00581     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00582     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00583     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00584     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00585 }
00586 
00587 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00588 
00589 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00590 
00591 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00592                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00593                                            const char *name)
00594 {
00595     struct task_struct *task = current;
00596 
00597     tcb->user_task = task;
00598     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00599     tcb->esp = 0;
00600     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00601     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00602     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00603 }
00604 
00605 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00606 
00607 {
00608     unsigned irq;
00609 
00610     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00611         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00612                              handler,
00613                              NULL,
00614                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00615 }
00616 
00617 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00618 
00619 {
00620     unsigned irq;
00621 
00622     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00623         {
00624         switch (irq)
00625             {
00626 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00627             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00628             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00629             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00630             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00631 
00632                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00633                 continue;
00634 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00635 
00636             default:
00637 
00638                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00639             }
00640         }
00641 }
00642 
00643 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00644 
00645 {
00646     unsigned irq;
00647 
00648     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00649         {
00650         switch (irq)
00651             {
00652 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00653             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00654             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00655             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00656             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00657 
00658                 continue;
00659 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00660 
00661             default:
00662 
00663                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00664             }
00665         }
00666 }
00667 
00668 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00669 
00670 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00671 
00672 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00673     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00674        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00675        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00676        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00677     rthal_timer_program_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00678 }
00679 
00680 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00681     rthal_timer_release();
00682 }
00683 
00684 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00685 
00686 {
00687 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00688     return adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00689 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00690     return 0;
00691 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00692 }
00693 
00694 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00695                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00696                                         unsigned long long defval)
00697 {
00698 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00699     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00700     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00701     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00702 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00703     *shot = defval;
00704     *delivery = defval;
00705 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00706 }
00707 
00708 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00709 
00710 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00711 
00712 #include <linux/init.h>
00713 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00714 
00715 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00716 
00717 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00718 
00719 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00720 
00721 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00722 
00723 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00724 
00725 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00726 
00727 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00728 {
00729     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00730 
00731     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00732     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00733     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00734 
00735     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00736 }
00737 
00738 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00739 
00740 {
00741 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00742     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00743 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00744     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00745        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00746        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00747        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00748        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00749        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00750     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00751 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00752 }
00753 
00754 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00755 
00756 {
00757     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00758 
00759     if (!nktimerlat)
00760         return -ENODEV;
00761 
00762     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00763 
00764     return 0;
00765 }
00766 
00767 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00768 
00769 {
00770     int err;
00771 
00772 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00773     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00774        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00775     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00776 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00777 
00778     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00779 
00780     if (err)
00781         return err;
00782 
00783     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00784 
00785     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00786         return -ENOSYS;
00787 
00788     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00789                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00790                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00791                               NULL,
00792                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00793 
00794     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00795 
00796 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00797     err = xnshadow_mount();
00798 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00799 
00800     if (err)
00801         {
00802         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00803         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00804         }
00805 
00806     return err;
00807 }
00808 
00809 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00810 
00811 {
00812 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00813     xnshadow_cleanup();
00814 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00815     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00816     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00817 }
00818 
00819 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00820 
00821 #ifdef __cplusplus
00822 }
00823 #endif
00824 
00825 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00826 
00827 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00828 
00829 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00830 
00831 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_I386_SYSTEM_H */
